The API provides endpoints for recognizing objects in pictures, checking content policy compliance, detecting mood from text, language detection, extracting text from images, summarizing long texts, detecting entities in text, translating text, and extracting contact information. These endpoints accept input in the form of text and images and return responses with information such as recognized labels, detected entities, mood analysis, translated text, and extracted contact information in various data formats.

The Remote Jobs API provides access to a list of remote job opportunities from various sources including weworkremotely, remoteok, GitHub, StackOverflow, Twitch, Mailchimp, Figma, and more. Users can utilize the GET method to retrieve the latest 20 remote jobs with optional parameters for filtering by company or category. The endpoint for getting a specific remote job requires the job ID as a string input parameter. Pagination functionality is also available through the GET method by specifying the page ID as a number input parameter. The output of the API includes details such as job title, company logo, location, company name, and date of posting in a structured JSON format.

The bracketPy API offers a range of functionalities for natural language processing and machine learning applications. Users can leverage the API to extract information from web pages, build predictive models, generate topic models, create recommendation engines, and more. The API supports various endpoints such as fetching URLs, extracting concepts, analyzing YouTube videos, identifying language, determining sentiment scores, calculating document and sentence similarities, categorizing content, suggesting hashtags, measuring word similarity, recognizing images, analyzing text tone and mood, classifying text based on semantic information, extracting named entities, creating content summaries, and finding similar phrases. Each endpoint operates through the POST method with no specific input parameters required, and responses are returned in JSON format.

The Giphy API provides a range of endpoints for interacting with animated GIFs. Users can utilize the 'Search' endpoint to search for GIFs based on a query term or phrase, with options for limiting the number of results and specifying ratings. The API supports GET method and requires a 'q' parameter of type STRING for search queries. The output parameter is JSON format and returns GIF search results based on the provided parameters. Additionally, users can access endpoints such as 'Get GIF by ID', 'Get GIFs by ID', 'Translate', 'Random', 'Trending GIFs', 'Sticker Search', 'STICKER Roulette', 'STICKER Trending', and 'STICKER Translate' for various functionalities related to GIFs and stickers with detailed input and output specifications.

The Datapi API provides endpoints for database accessibility, allowing users to send, query, get, and set data via HTTP POST and GET methods. The API supports string input parameters for ID and returns JSON data. The 'Send Data' endpoint enables users to send or save data to the backend API, while the 'Query Data' endpoint allows data querying within the API. Additionally, users can create unique addresses, private and public key pairs, UUIDs, and query values by ID through respective endpoints. The 'Make ID' endpoint generates a unique address with associated keys using Bitcoin's wallet structure, and the 'Make UUID' endpoint creates a unique UUID using Bitcoin's public and private key combination. The API also offers functionalities to set and retrieve values for a particular ID. The service is available under a FREEMIUM pricing model.

The API offers functions to estimate salary ranges, classify job descriptions, extract information from job descriptions, and moderate job descriptions. The API includes endpoints like classifyJD for classifying job functions and seniority levels based on O*NET SOC codes, extractYearsExperience for extracting years of experience from job descriptions, extractSalaryRange for extracting salary ranges, startAsyncJobDescriptionReview for asynchronously reviewing job descriptions, startAsyncJobDescriptionModeration for asynchronously moderating job descriptions, startAsyncJobDescriptionReformatting for asynchronously reformatting job descriptions, checkJobDescriptionFormat for checking HTML job description formatting, and createJobDescription for creating a job description. The API supports POST method for all endpoints with no required parameters, and response schemas include different data types like strings, integers, booleans, and objects.

The API Checky - Verify Phone Number offers functionalities to determine the validity and type of a given phone number in real-time, supporting all countries. The API provides endpoints for verifying phone numbers individually or in batch using POST requests to receive information on the phone number's type and national format. Additionally, users can retrieve information about the carrier or service provider for a given phone number through dedicated endpoints. The 'Verify' endpoint requires a GET request with parameters 'country' (two-letter country code) and 'phone' (phone number without special characters) in the query string. The service is accessed through both GET and POST methods, with detailed usage explained in the API documentation.

The Certified Translation API offers a range of endpoints for handling translation-related tasks. Users can interact with the API through methods such as GET and POST to manage account information, retrieve specific orders, list orders, pay quotes, create quotes, upload files, and retrieve information on available languages. Input parameters include order numbers, quote tokens, files for upload (in formats like PDF, DOC, JPG), and metadata for assisting in pricing and turnaround time determinations. The API provides responses with key-value pairs and support for webhook updates on order processing. Overall, the service facilitates professional translations of complex documents with support for human translators and certification.

name: CodeMorph
summary: CodeMorph is an AI-powered code translation tool that converts code from one programming language to another. Users can submit code snippets or entire codebases, and the API returns the translated code in the desired target language. The AI technology ensures accurate and reliable translations by understanding and mapping equivalent functionalities between languages.

name: Dictionary
summary: The Dictionary API provides definitions of words using data from Oxford. Users can retrieve any definition they need by accessing this endpoint, which returns comprehensive information about words.

The API offers functionalities to calculate carbon footprints in various scenarios such as air quality, paper production, traditional and clean hydro energy usage, fuel consumption, car travel, air travel, motorbike travel, and public transportation. Using GET method, the 'AirQualityHealthIndex' endpoint returns the official air quality health index based on ground-level ozone, nitrogen dioxide, and fine particulate matter levels. 'TreeEquivalent' calculates the number of trees equivalent to paper production, while 'TraditionalHydroToCarbonFootprint' calculates CO2 emissions from traditional hydro energy. 'CleanHydroToCarbonFootprint' calculates CO2 emissions from clean hydro energy usage. Other endpoints like 'CarbonFootprintFromCarTravel', 'CarbonFootprintFromFlight', 'CarbonFootprintFromMotorBike', and 'CarbonFootprintFromPublicTransit' determine CO2 emissions from car, flight, motorbike, and public transit journeys respectively.

The Movie Quote API allows users to find quotes from millions of movies and series that are time-based, contextualized, and linked with the IMDb movie database. The API offers a method 'GET' to retrieve quotes based on a keyword input parameter of type 'string', which has a default value of 'so far so good'. The output parameters include details such as movie title, year, cover image URL, quote phrase, and time stamp. Users can access movie quotes through the provided endpoint and customize the search by specifying different keywords to explore a wide range of quotes from various films.

The API 'Beverages and Desserts' provides access to various beverages and desserts. Users can retrieve details of desserts and beverages by their IDs using the GET method. The 'Get Desserts by their ID' endpoint requires a string input ID parameter to fetch specific desserts, while the 'Get Beverage by their ID' endpoint fetches specific beverages based on the provided ID. Additionally, users can retrieve a list of all desserts and beverages through separate endpoints using the GET method. The output of these endpoints includes information such as name, description, images, price, and ingredients of the selected dessert or beverage.

The API provides various endpoints for retrieving data related to Pokemon Go, including type effectiveness, Pokemon rarity, power-up requirements, genders, current moves, evolutions, raid exclusive Pokemon, buddy distances, candy requirements for evolution, Pokemon stats, nesting Pokemon, maximum CP, shiny Pokemon, Alolan Pokemon, fast moves, Pokemon names, charged moves, released Pokemon, weather boosts, possible Ditto Pokemon, Pokemon types, encounter data, and more. Users can access the API through GET requests to retrieve JSON data with details such as Pokemon types, stats, evolutions, moves, rarity, shiny availability, and encounter information. The API does not require any input parameters for these endpoints, and the output consists of JSON objects or arrays containing relevant Pokemon information.

The API provides access to global news generated by AI, allowing users to retrieve news articles from various regions. The API offers endpoints such as 'Available Regions' to list all regions available and 'Get News' to fetch news by region. The 'Get News' method requires parameters including 'region' (string) for the region's key code and 'version' (string) for the API version. The output of 'Get News' includes articles with details such as source, author, title, description, URL, and published date. Additionally, users can access related news, full content extraction, news images, and news videos through dedicated endpoints. The API supports GET and POST methods, requiring proper authentication headers for usage.

The Keyword Suggestion API offers developers the ability to retrieve a list of suggested keywords related to a specific topic or phrase. It helps in optimizing website content, improving search engine rankings, and generating content ideas. The API provides suggestions based on criteria such as search volume, competition, and relevance, and also offers insights into keyword search trends over time. Available endpoints include 'All' for all related keywords, 'Alphabetical' for alphabetical suggestions, 'Comparisons' for comparison keywords, 'Preposition' for prepositional keywords, 'Questions' for question-related keywords, and 'Related' for related search terms. The API supports GET method with required parameters like 'keyword' (string) and optional parameters like 'country_code' and 'language_code'. The output schema includes different categories of keywords along with their respective arrays of related terms.

The 4eat API offers functionalities for managing user recipes, user registration, adding recipes, and generating weekly nutritional plans. Users can utilize the 'post-userRecipe' endpoint to create personalized healthy recipes, 'post-signupUser' endpoint to register new users with detailed information for personalized nutrition services, 'post-addRecipe' endpoint to include recipes in their catalog, and 'post-newWeek' endpoint to generate weekly nutritional plans. The API includes methods for accessing setup data and recipe details. The endpoints support POST method for data submission, and the output schema for the 'post-newWeek' endpoint includes a structured week plan object with details such as week ID, days, meals per day, meal types, recipe IDs, names, subcategories, cooking level, time, and ingredient quantities for optimal nutrition planning.

US Gas Prices API offers access to current and historical gas price data for various states in the US. The API provides endpoints such as /us/hi for Hawaii, /us/id for Idaho, /us/in for Indiana, and more, each returning the current gas price data. Users can query historical data by including the optional 'date' parameter in the request. The API supports GET method for fetching data, and users can specify the date parameter in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format to retrieve specific historical data. The output format is JSON by default, but users can request XML format by adding the 'Accept: application/xml' header in the request.

The Advanced Movie Search API allows users to search for movies using advanced queries like genre, name, etc., and retrieve detailed information about them. The API includes the following endpoints: 

1. 'Genre List': A GET method that retrieves a list of all available genres. It does not require any input parameters.

2. 'Search by Name': A GET method that searches for a movie by a query string. It requires the parameter 'query' (string) for the search term and has an optional parameter 'page' (number) for pagination. The output includes a list of movies with details such as ID, title, overview, popularity, release date, and vote average.

3. 'Get Detailed Response': A GET method that provides detailed information for a specific movie ID. It requires the parameter 'movie_id' (number) and returns details including the movie's budget, genres, homepage, ID, IMDb ID, original language, original title, overview, popularity, poster path, and production companies. The API supports GET methods and requires appropriate authentication headers for usage.

The `certer.org` API offers a range of utilities for hashing, encoding, converting, and validating data. It includes endpoints for hashing strings using algorithms like Whirlpool and GOST, converting text to Leet or bytes to human-readable formats, and validating binary numbers, email addresses, IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, and Roman numerals. Each endpoint utilizes the POST method and accepts parameters like strings, numbers, and binary data. For example, the `/hash/whirlpool` endpoint requires a string (`value`) to hash and returns a hashed string. The `/converter/bytes/human` endpoint requires a number (`bytes`) and returns a human-readable string representation. All endpoints return data in JSON format.

The Foxit eSign API allows users to manage document signing workflows and folders through various endpoints. You can download individual documents as PDFs (`documentDownload`), update folder details such as recipient information (`updateFolder`), view activity history of a specific folder (`activityHistory`), create new folders and send documents for signatures (`createfolder`), delete folders permanently (`delete`), regenerate embedded signing sessions (`regenerateEmbeddedSigningSession`), move folders to a recycle bin (`movetorecyclebin`), retrieve data from specific folders (`myfolder`), and get the history of deleted folders (`deletedLog`). Each endpoint supports either GET or POST methods, with the majority requiring folder IDs and optional parameters for detailed configurations.

The Route Optimization API provides functionality to calculate the fastest route between multiple waypoints for different modes of transportation, including driving, cycling, walking, and public transit. With the `Route and directions` endpoint, users can obtain detailed turn-by-turn directions for their selected routing mode. This API supports specifying waypoints as latitude and longitude coordinates and allows users to choose their preferred mode of travel. It also provides routing information including travel time and distance, making it a versatile tool for optimizing travel routes.

The Route and Directions API provides detailed route calculation with turn-by-turn navigation between multiple waypoints. By specifying latitude and longitude coordinates separated by pipes (`|`) and selecting a mode of transportation (e.g., drive, bicycle, walk, or transit), users receive a GeoJSON-formatted response that includes navigation instructions, travel time, and distance for the route. This API is ideal for generating precise travel directions and optimizing routes based on chosen transportation methods.

The Check Disposable Email API allows you to verify whether an email address is from a disposable or temporary domain, which is often used for spamming or trolling. It provides endpoints to check if an email is valid, look up disposable emails, and validate email addresses. Additionally, it includes features to retrieve information about newly registered domains and perform WHOIS lookups. This API is useful for ensuring the integrity of user data and preventing abuse through disposable email addresses.

The AccuWeather API provides detailed weather forecasts including current conditions, historical data, and forecasts for top cities worldwide. It offers endpoints to retrieve current conditions, historical weather data for the past 6 and 24 hours, and weather conditions for top-ranked cities. The API allows customization of responses with language and detail options and requires an API key for access. This API is suitable for applications needing accurate and detailed weather information.

The Coinbase API allows users to perform various cryptocurrency transactions and retrieve real-time data on bitcoin and ethereum. It includes endpoints for getting current exchange rates, canceling and completing money requests, and committing buys, deposits, sells, and withdrawals. The API requires an access token for authentication and supports base currency customization. This API is ideal for applications that need to handle cryptocurrency transactions and real-time market data.

The Google Cloud Storage API enables users to store and manage data in Google Cloud. It includes endpoints for retrieving bucket information, managing IAM policies, and composing objects from existing ones. Key functionalities include listing buckets for a project, fetching IAM policies, and concatenating multiple objects into a single one. The API requires Google Cloud Access Token for authentication and offers customizable query parameters for listing and managing resources. This API is well-suited for applications needing robust cloud storage solutions.

The Dropbox API allows users to access, store, and sync files online and across multiple devices. It provides endpoints for managing files, including adding members to files, retrieving file metadata, and syncing changes. The API requires an access token for authentication and supports various file operations, making it suitable for applications that need seamless file management and collaboration features. Access to the API is free.

The API-FORMULA-1 provides comprehensive data on Formula 1, including information about circuits, teams, drivers, and rankings. It features endpoints for retrieving race results, starting grid rankings, and other F1-related data. With a high service level and popularity score, it offers reliable access to Formula 1 statistics and updates. The API is available under a freemium pricing model, with detailed documentation accessible at https://api-sports.io/documentation/formula-1/v1.

The Image Search API provides developers with a tool to integrate image search functionality into their applications or websites. It allows for querying images based on search terms and delivers relevant image results. With a freemium pricing model, it offers high service levels and reliability, as indicated by its high popularity score. More details and documentation can be found at https://rapidapi.com/Glavier/api/image-search19/.

The Cities Cost of Living API provides detailed information about living expenses in over 650 cities worldwide. It allows users to retrieve data on the cost of living in various cities and currencies. With a freemium pricing model, the API has high service levels and reliability, as evidenced by its popularity score. More information and documentation can be found at https://rapidapi.com/ditno-ditno-default/api/cities-cost-of-living1/.

The BigOven API allows users to access 350,000+ recipes, reviews, and nutrition facts. The API supports functionalities such as adding recipe images and adding recipes to the grocery list. The 'addRecipeImage' endpoint enables users to upload an image for a recipe, specifying image position latitude, longitude, and caption. Input parameters include API Key, user password, recipe ID, and image file in various datatypes. The output parameter returns the JSON response containing the success status of the image upload. The 'addRecipeToGroceryList' endpoint allows users to add a recipe to the grocery list with options to mark the recipe lines as pending and scale the recipe size. The API supports POST method for both endpoints, with detailed parameter descriptions and expected JSON response.

The API allows users to search for cities by name and retrieve a list of cities that match the specified query. The endpoint supports GET method and requires a 'q' parameter of type STRING for the search query. Optional parameters include 'page', 'country_code', 'sortOrder', 'sortBy', 'country_name', 'country_id', 'limit', 'state_code', 'state_id', and 'state_name'. The API returns city information in JSON format with details such as city name, state name, country code, and country name. Users can access the service for free through the provided endpoint URL.

The Concerts - Artists Events Tracker API provides access to live, upcoming, and past music events based on location, venue, and artist name. It supports querying past events by venue name and time period. With its freemium pricing model, the API boasts a high service level and reliability, as reflected in its popularity score. More information and documentation are available at https://rapidapi.com/s.mahmoud97/api/concerts-artists-events-tracker/.

The EcoWeather API provides economically relevant meteorological data such as heat degree days and average temperature. It offers endpoints to retrieve data on snow days within a specified period, useful for winter service planning and tourism. The API follows a freemium pricing model and has a solid service level and reliability. For more details, visit https://rapidapi.com/stromdao-stromdao-default/api/ecoweather/.

name: Motivation-api
summary: Motivation-api provides daily inspiration and motivation for your work. It offers a simple GET endpoint to fetch motivational data from its home page.

name: Electricity Carbon Footprint Germany
summary: This API provides the CO2 footprint of electricity in Germany, expressed in grams per Kilo-Watt-Hour. It offers both current and historical emission data, with options to query by specific dates or get trends for the last 30 and 365 days.

MedAPI offers a collection of medical calculators, scores, and algorithms. It provides endpoints for calculating the AKIN classification for Acute Kidney Injury and the Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) for pediatric individuals using the revised Schwartz Equation. The API is free to use and provides detailed medical calculations based on input parameters. For more information, visit [MedAPI](https://rapidapi.com/metrapi-metrapi-default/api/medapi2/).

Google News API provides real-time news and articles sourced from Google News. It offers endpoints to retrieve supported languages and regions, allowing integration of news functionalities into applications. The API is available with a freemium pricing model. For more information, visit [Google News API](https://rapidapi.com/bfd-id/api/google-news13/).

The AllScores API offers extensive real-time scores and updates for over 2,000 competitions across 10 sports, including Football, Rugby, Tennis, Basketball, Cricket, Ice Hockey, Baseball, Volleyball, American Football, and Handball. It provides real-time stats, breaking news, in-play insights, lineups, live tables, fixtures, social buzz, and odds. The API is available with a freemium pricing model. For more details, visit [AllScores API](https://rapidapi.com/fluis.lacasse/api/allscores/).

api_name: Face Detection with Age and Gender Estimation
summary: The Face Detection with Age and Gender Estimation API allows users to detect all faces in a photo and estimate their age and gender. The API requires a base64-encoded image in a POST request and returns the coordinates of detected faces along with age and gender estimations in a JSON response. It offers a freemium pricing model. For more details, visit [Face Detection with Age and Gender Estimation API](https://rapidapi.com/yotaverse1-yotaverse-default/api/face-detection-with-age-and-gender-estimation/).

The Hotels API provides comprehensive information about hotel properties worldwide, including details on rooms, prices, facilities, and policies. It's designed for creating travel-related applications or websites. The API offers a freemium pricing model and boasts high reliability with a 100% average service level and success rate. For more details, visit [Hotels API](https://rapidapi.com/apidojo/api/hotels4/).

The Call of Duty API provides access to stats for Modern Warfare and Warzone players and matches. It allows for easy creation of responsive dashboards and scripts. The API is free to use and offers high service reliability with an average service level of 100% and low latency. For more information, visit [Call of Duty API](https://rapidapi.com/sohamp2812/api/call-of-duty8/).

The Funny Joke Dataset API provides a collection of English jokes for testing and development purposes. It includes jokes from various categories such as Animal, Bar, One Liners, and more. The API offers a freemium pricing model and has high service reliability with an average service level of 100%. For more details, visit [Funny Joke Dataset API](https://rapidapi.com/abiodunoluwasegunsharafa-Pu9kywlF-YE/api/funny-joke-dataset/).

BasketAPI provides comprehensive basketball data, including live scores, results, schedules, and statistics for over 70 basketball leagues worldwide. It covers leagues like the NBA, Euroleague, NCAA, and more. The API is freemium with a high service level, averaging 100% success rate. For more details, visit [BasketAPI](https://rapidapi.com/fluis.lacasse/api/basketapi1/).
